intro: Eupatorium lasseauxii, commonly known as the Louisiana boneset, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Eupatorium lasseauxii is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
